messages.message:
Hello!

I did the setup to run services with provisioner.py according to the doc (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2213183494/Use+PPY+on+Crafting)

Run the `tools/devtools/ssl/setup_ssl.sh` but I’m still getting certificate warnings.
```owner@dev:~/instabase$ ls -l /home/owner/instabase/webserver/server-nginx/build/certificates/
total 8
-rw-r--r-- 1 owner owner 1330 Oct  4 08:51 default.crt
-rw-r--r-- 1 owner owner 1704 Oct  4 08:51 default.key
owner@dev:~/instabase$ cat $IB_HOME/webserver/server-nginx/certificates/passphrase
Instabase```
@Xindi Xu can you help?
This looks right! Can you click “advanced” and then something like “ignore the warning and proceed”. You should be able to see the UI. Usually this page shows up when you restart nginx
Yes I can access the page. But always see the red certificate warning in the address bar. Is that expected?
